comments:
Using Eclipse 3.2 RC7

The Compare editor does not handle Window > New editor gracefully.  If you open a new copy of the compare editor and then close it, the original thinks it is closed too, resulting in a stack trace.  Steps to reproduce:

1.  Open the compare editor, for example, by choosing from the Package
    Explorer's context menu Compare With > Latest from HEAD.

2.  Select Window > New Editor to open a copy of the compare editor.

3.  Close the newly opened compare editor.

4.  Back at the original compare editor, try clicking on one of the changes.

5.  A dialog will open telling you to check the .log file.
